title: Early morning shooting wounds four
content: An early morning shooting left four people wounded — one of them critically — as someone shot into the residence in which they were standing, according to a police report. Fort Wayne Police responded to the shooting at 12:30 a.m. today in the 6600 block of Pawawna Drive, where officers and paramedics found two victims inside the residence suffering apparent gunshot wounds. Paramedics treated the victims before transporting them to a local hospital, where a man is listed in critical condition and a woman was listed in good condition. A short time later, two women arrived at a local hospital suffering from apparent gunshot wounds. They are listed in good condition. The victims were inside the residence when a person, or persons, fired gunshot wounds into the rear of the house from the outside. All four who were shot were standing inside the residence. At this time, the incident remains under investigation by the Fort Wayne Police Department and the Allen County Prosecutor's Office. There is no suspect information and no arrests have been made.
